title: Gates Of The Arctic National Park & Preserve: Permits & Reservations
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Permits & Reservations              Permits & Reservations       Reservations Reservations are not required for any areas or activities within the park & preserve, except for groups. If you are traveling in a group (i.e. nonprofit, educational, commercial, guided, etc.) please contact the park several months before your travel dates for permit requirements and group size limits. NOTE: Commercial transporters are required to ensure that all of their clients get the opportunity to receive a backcountry orientation from park rangers prior to entering the park and preserve. Please take a moment to complete our voluntary registration form prior to your trip into the backcountry.      Commercial Activities A business or an individual must obtain either a Concession Contract or a Commercial Use Authorization (CUA) prior to conducting any commercial activity in Gates of the Arctic National Park & Preserve. These contracts and permits are issued and administered by the National Park Service (NPS). Download a list of authorized commercial guides in Gates of the Arctic or contact the visitor center in Bettles with further questions at 907-692-5494. Learn how to obtain a permit to conduct business in the park by visiting the website of the NPS Alaska Regional Office.      Other Permits  Commercial Filming -- Commercial operations wishing to film within the boundaries of the preserve must obtain a filming permit. Special Use Permits -- This catch-all category covers permits that may be necessary for a variety of activities, such as organizing a large wedding in the park. Contact us for more details on Special Use Permits.
